Key Match Events: The Kings closed the third quarter on a 17-2 run
Pre-Game Insights: Doug Christie told his players: “You’re getting close.”
Christie cited a Bob Marley lyric about taking a bucket to the well and not knowing when the bottom will fall out
Christie stressed to his players that they shouldn’t allow the referees to derail the gameplan
Post-Match Reflections: Christie said: “Are we going to still struggle from time to time? Yes, but the good will needed to happen to show that lot of things that we talk about — we’re able to do. Now, we need to do it with the consistency, the intensity and the violent aggression, in my opinion, that needs to be there to win games at this level.”
Domantas Sabonis said that seeing Christie get his first win was “really cool.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings held the Mavericks to just 40 points in the second half
Christie’s initial goals are incremental: Simplifying the offense in game one, followed by the defense in game two
Others: Christie’s job involves letting his players play after putting them in a position to succeed
Christie hopes to improve the team’s record in close contests
